errors: Line 9: Incomplete tag (likely missing '>') -> <nav class="navbar" id="navbar"

ai_analysis.analysis: The `<nav>` tag on line 9 is missing its closing angle bracket `>`. This causes the browser to misinterpret the following content as part of the tag's attributes.

The `<title>` tag is crucial for defining the title of the HTML document, which appears in the browser's title bar or tab. It's important for SEO and user experience. The provided code lacks this tag within the `<head>`.

fix_solution.correction:
Add the closing angle bracket to the `<nav>` tag.

```html
<nav class="navbar" id="navbar">
```
---

Add a `<title>` tag within the `<head>` section to specify the document's title.

```html
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
    <title>The Meridian Grand</title>
</head>
```
---
